Hey guys, hope you're well. I'm gonna show
you how to make the most gorgeous

Roast chicken Margherita. This is a roast
chicken dish like you've never seen

before. It's fun, it's delicious, it's
super-easy and it's one of my recipes

from my brand new cookbook "7 Ways".
Now "7 Ways" is all about doing

seven really exciting ways with the
things that you normally buy every week,

right. So this is in the whole chicken
chapter, super straightforward and I know

you guys know how to roast a chicken and
my job is to give you exciting things to

do with that chicken. 
So, Roast chicken Margherita, we're in

Italy. Tomatoes – Margherita, basil – Margherita. 
And I'm not going to do roast potatoes

I'm gonna make big giant gnocchi stuffed
with the mozzarella. So let me show you
how bloomin' easy it is, right. Tomatoes off the vine. Right, cut it in half like

this, into a tray. Get yourself about 1.5
kilos of those tomatoes. I'm gonna put

two bulbs of garlic in their skins. Now
when you slow roast the garlic with the

tomatoes inside those skins, it's gonna
be mild and tender and fragrant, and it's

gonna be absolutely delicious.
We're gonna go salt, pepper. We're gonna

put a nice swig of vinegar in there, red
wine vinegar. Go in with some olive oil

Rip the basil off into there. Get the
stalks, put that inside the cavity of the

chicken and then what we can do is
season the tomatoes, the garlic, oil,

vinegar, then we can take some of that
oil and vinegar and rub it over a

chicken. And then the little clever
tricks don't stop there. Let me just wash

my hands. Now the genius thing here is
we're gonna take the chicken and we're

gonna put it directly onto the bars
here like that and we'll put the tomatoes

underneath. By putting the chicken
directly on the bars it'll roast 360

degrees. The skin will go crispy, the fat
will render, it will drip all the

goodness onto the tomatoes making them
so tasty. So that will cook for about an

hour and 20 minutes, hour and 30 minutes
at 180°C, which is 350°F

Here, I've been boiling some
potatoes, so just drain your potatoes and

then back into the pan. Now with these
potatoes I've left the skin on, you can

peel it if you want, but I want to mash
these. Salt,

pepper, and then we go from mashed potato
to a gnocchi. You want to add about a

heaped tablespoon or 50g of plain flour.
Mash this up now and we can just scoop

it out onto a board and this is where we
start having fun. So in this book I

wanted to use ingredients that you can
get in a regular supermarket and I
wanted to turn the everyday and mundane into something exciting and I think this

might just do it. So divide this mashed
potato up into 12 balls and they'll

be quite chunky, and then stick your
finger right in the middle giving you

that nice place to hide 12 chunks of
your cheese. So just slice it up. Get

yourself a baking tray, oil it up so
they go nice and crispy. Chunk of cheese,

chunk of potatoes, hole in the middle,
push it in like that and then simply

close it up. It's child's play. It's gonna
be amazing. These want to roast for about

an hour and that's perfect timing – the
chicken's been in for like, you know, 10-15

minutes. This will go on the bottom of

gorgeous and I'll show you what to do

So I'll take the chicken off and I'll

onto the rack is brilliant because
you get this beautifully rendered skin

but it also allows you to roast all

I'll squeeze the garlic out.
